title: PCBs in Seals in a Food Web

content.prompt: A biologist is studying a small food web in which phytoplankton are eaten by krill, krill are eaten by fish, and fish are eaten by seals. During their study of the ecosystem, the biologist discovers that PCBs are present in measurable levels in the water and wants to examine how PCBs could vary in different trophic levels. Which of the following best identifies a testable hypothesis for the study?

choices.label: Biomagnification will cause the phytoplankton outside the study area to have the highest amount of PCBs in their tissues.
Biomagnification will cause the seals to have the highest amount of PCBs in their tissues.
Bioaccumulation will cause the seals outside the study area to have the highest amount of PCBs in their tissues.
Bioaccumulation will cause the fish to have the highest amount of PCBs in their tissues.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify a testable hypothesis or scientific question for an investigation.
